When I was taking classes on Pro Tools, the final exam was to sit one on one with the instructor and set up and navigate a session in the program without using the mouse almost at all. 95% of the exam it was both hands on the keyboard being as efficient
with hotkeys as you possibly could
"Be so efficient that you're waiting on the client. If the client has to wait on you because you're wasting time searching with a mouse, then you're losing a client."
He was a hardass professor, but he was fantastic at what he did.
Dude was professional to the core.
Wow....so, is that just editing?
The exam? Or Pro Tools in general?
Pro tools in general
It does everything audio. Recording, editing, setting it to video. Whatever you can imagine you can do to audio plus a bunch that you didn't know you could.
